item.title: Solucion ejercicio 1
item.description: #include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() { int levels; cin >> levels; for(int level = 1; level <= levels; level++) { for(int aster = 1; aster <= level; aster++) { cout << "* "; } cout << "\n"; } }

item.title: Solucion ejercicio 1
item.description: #include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() { int n; cin >> n; int divs = 0; for (int i = 2; i <= sqrt(n); i++) { divs += ( n % i == 0 ); } if(divs) { cout << n << " is not prime\n"; } else { cout << n << " is prime\n"; } return 0; }

item.title: Solucion ejercicio 1
item.description: #include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() { int n; cin >> n; for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++) { cout << i << "\n"; } return 0; }

item.title: Solucion ejercicio 1
item.description: #include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() { int levels; cin >> levels; for(int level = 1; level <= levels; level++) { for(int espacios = 1; espacios <= (levels - level); espacios++) { cout << " "; } for(int aster = 1; aster <= (2*level - 1); aster++) { cout << "* "; } cout << "\n"; } }

item.title: Solucion ejercicio 1
item.description: #include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() { int levels; cin >> levels; for(int level = levels; level > 0; level--) { for(int aster = 1; aster <= level; aster++) { cout << "* "; } cout << "\n"; } }

item.title: Solucion ejercicio 1
item.description: #include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() { int n; cin >> n; for (int i = 0; i <= n / 2; i++) { cout << 2 * i + 1<< "\n"; } return 0; }

item.title: Solucion ejercicio 1
item.description: #include <iostream> using namespace std; int main() { int n; cin >> n; for (int i = 1; i <= n / 2; i++) { cout << 2 * i << "\n"; } return 0; }

item.title: Ciclos
item.description: Los ciclos son estructuras basicas de los lenguajes de programcion estos nos permiten repetir un conjunto instrucciones
